I used to own the Google Home Mini 1st Gen for a few years until recently. Compared to those, I can confidently say that the audio from the Google Nest Hub 2nd Gen sounds significantly better. Since it's still the same google assistant, it didn't get any smarter or anything. I faced the same issues that I did previously, but at least the screen would provide some information rather than it annoyingly sending a link it found to my phone. Speaking of the screen, it's really nice despite it being small. It being small is advantageous since I like having my smart device sitting by the window next to my bed. I feel the 10" one wouldn't have fit as well. If you haven't touched the sceen in a while, it's laggy but once it gets going, it moves at a sufficient speed. I talk to it more than I touch the interface so it's not an issue I run into too often. I wish I could download apps onto the device, or remove some of them since I don't use Sling. It's a bit hard to use youtube on it as well. It's nice that it's easy to cast to it. I often cast twitch steams or audiobooks to it and it works out really well. It makes calls easily, and it can be helpful for routines or controlling your smart home. It's sleep sensing is surprisingly really good. I've been using it for about 2 weeks now and if you use the sleep sensing, I recommend that you download google fit so that you can view your sleep data easier. The sleep sensing on the google nest was able to provide pretty much the same data as my galaxy watch 7 when it came to detecting sleep. It might not be that interesting, but I thought it was cool since the google nest uses motion sensing rather than making direct contact with my body while I sleep. 
You can also search websites on the nest hub, but I wouldn't recommend it since it would be slower than on your phone, and it doesn't really have much of a practical use, at least to me anyway. All in all, I really like this device. It's nice being able to control the dim of my light from my bed, but without having to pick up my phone. Sometimes I don't feel like speaking to start some routines, so the touch interface and gestures are appreciated. I thought google was getting rid of the sleep sensing, but somehow it still isn't gone yet. (Hopefully I haven't jinxed it)

The sound quality is better than expected for a device of its size, making it suitable for casual music listening or podcasts. I also love the ability to watch YouTube videos and use it as a digital photo frame with Google Photos integration.

Overall, the Google Nest Hub has exceeded my expectations, and I highly recommend it to anyone looking to enhance their smart home experience. Best Buy's customer service was excellent, and the purchase process was smooth and hassle-free.

I say it like that because one of the things I really wanted it to do was shuffle through pictures of my partner. And I for the life of me could not get it to do that. It does not swipe through apps or open anything seamlessly. Overall, I do really like it now that it does what I bought it for, especially because I got it significantly on sale. As an avid tech enthusiast, I recently had the pleasure of exploring the Nest Hub 7” Smart Display with Google Assistant (2nd Gen). This versatile smart device has quickly become an integral part of my daily routine. From its vibrant display and responsive performance to the seamless integration of Google Assistant, the Nest Hub offers a delightful smart home experience. In this user review, I'll share my thoughts on its key features and overall usability.

Design and Display:

The Nest Hub's design is a masterpiece of simplicity and elegance. The 7-inch display is encased in a sleek fabric finish that seamlessly blends into any home decor. The compact form factor ensures it doesn't occupy much space, making it ideal for bedside tables, kitchen counters, or even as a digital photo frame.

The touch-sensitive display is bright and vibrant, rendering colors beautifully. Whether watching videos, checking the weather, or displaying family photos, the Nest Hub provides crisp visuals with wide viewing angles, making it a joy to interact with.

Google Assistant Integration:

The highlight of the Nest Hub is, undoubtedly, the seamless integration of Google Assistant. The far-field microphones are impressively accurate, even from a distance, allowing for hands-free voice commands. Setting timers, asking for recipes, or controlling smart home devices has never been more convenient. The responsiveness and accuracy of Google Assistant are top-notch, making it an invaluable personal assistant for day-to-day tasks.

Media and Entertainment:

The Nest Hub excels as a media hub as well. Watching YouTube videos, streaming Netflix, or even listening to music is a delight with its crisp display and surprisingly impressive speaker quality. While it might not replace a high-end speaker system, the Nest Hub's audio output is clear, balanced, and loud enough for casual entertainment.

Smart Home Control:

As a central hub for my smart home devices, the Nest Hub easily controls lights, thermostats, smart plugs, and more. The Home View dashboard provides an intuitive interface to manage all connected devices efficiently. I particularly appreciate the "Ambient EQ" feature, which automatically adjusts the display's brightness and color temperature based on the room's lighting conditions, creating a pleasant and comfortable viewing experience.

Privacy and Security:

Google has made strides in improving user privacy, and the Nest Hub reflects this commitment. The physical mute switch for the microphone offers a sense of control over when the device listens to you, and the integrated camera shutter allows for covering the camera when it's not in use.

Minor Considerations:

While the Nest Hub is an excellent smart display, there are a couple of areas for potential improvement. The absence of a built-in camera might disappoint users who wish to make video calls or use it for video conferencing. Additionally, a larger display option for those who prefer a more immersive media experience would be a welcome addition.

Conclusion:

The Nest Hub 7” Smart Display with Google Assistant (2nd Gen) is a brilliant smart home device that brings convenience and elegance to any living space. Its sleek design, vibrant display, and seamless integration of Google Assistant make it a must-have for anyone invested in a smart home ecosystem. Although a built-in camera and a larger display option could enhance its versatility, the Nest Hub excels in its primary functions and delivers an outstanding user experience. I highly recommend it to anyone seeking a smart display that truly enriches their daily life.
